nodes.excerpt: When it comes to warming up for a training session we follow a very simple yet effective method. RAMP.
nodes.title: The Warm Up : Our approach Yo

nodes.excerpt: I am very excited to be joining the CT Barbell team as their Sports Massage Therapist. I have always had a keen interest in sport and maintaining physical fitness to prevent injury. Top performance can’t all be about training, the real success comes from looking at the whole picture, knowing the balance between strengthening and stretching, training and recovering. I believe sports massage has a key role to play in keeping every individual, regardless of their chosen discipline, in peak fitness. The key is to remain injury free or at the very least recover from injury quickly. Long term we all need to ensure we can remain well and mobile as we get older.
nodes.title: Rosalind South : Sports Massage Therapist

nodes.excerpt: With National league rugby fast approaching comes the inevitable Sunday mornings after a game where you feel like you have been hit by a train. Now seems as good a time as any to talk about the ways in which we can impact our recovery through both active and passive recovery.
nodes.title: Active v Passive Recovery
